org.criteria4jpa.criterion
Class Restrictions

java.lang.Object
  org.criteria4jpa.criterion.Restrictions

public class Restrictions
extends Object

Factory class for Criterion instances that can be added to a criteria by calling Criteria.add(Criterion).

Note that most path expressions are relative, meaning that they are rooted at the entity of the criteria they are added to. In this cases there is no need to add any kind of alias to the path expression because this is already done by the framework.

Author:
Christian Kaltepoth

like

public static SimpleExpression like(String relativePath,
                                    String value)
Adds a "like" constraint to a persistent field. This method expects the value to already contain the required wildcard characters. Alternatively you can call like(String, String, MatchMode) to let the restriction add the wildcards.

Parameters:
relativePath - relative path of the field
value - the match string
Returns:
Criterion instance

like

public static SimpleExpression like(String relativePath,
                                    String value,
                                    MatchMode matchMode)
Adds a "like" constraint to a persistent field. This method requires a MatchMode to specify how wildcards are added to the value. You may also use like(String, String) if you want to manually specify the wildcards in the match string.

Parameters:
relativePath - relative path of the field
value - the match string
matchMode - specifies how to add wildcards to the value to create the LIKE expression
Returns:
Criterion instance

Parameters:
relativePath - relative path of the string field
value - the match string
Returns:
Criterion instance

conjunction

public static Conjunction conjunction()
Creates a group for multiple restrictions that are connected by a conjunction. The group generates multiple expressions joined by a logical AND. You can add restrictions to the group by calling Junction.add(Criterion) on the returned object. As the Conjunction itself is a restriction, it can be added to a criteria instance via Criteria.add(Criterion).

Returns:
Conjunction instance

disjunction

public static Disjunction disjunction()
Creates a group for multiple restrictions that are connected by a disjunction. The group generates multiple expressions joined by a logical OR. You can add restrictions to the group by calling Junction.add(Criterion) on the returned object. As the Disjunction itself is a restriction, it can be added to a criteria instance via Criteria.add(Criterion).

Returns:
Disjunction instance

Parameters:
criterion - Restriction to negate
Returns:
Criterion instance

and

public static Conjunction and(Criterion... criterionList)
Connects multiple restrictions with an logical conjunction. Calling this method is a shortcut for creating a Conjunction by calling conjunction() and adding all restrictions to it.

Parameters:
criterionList - The restrictions to add to the conjunction.
Returns:
Conjunction instance

or

public static Disjunction or(Criterion... criterionList)
Connects multiple restrictions with an logical disjunction. Calling this method is a shortcut for creating a Disjunction by calling disjunction() and adding all restrictions to it.

Parameters:
criterionList - The restrictions to add to the disjunction.
Returns:
Disjunction instance

allEq

public static Criterion allEq(Map<String,Object> values)

Creates a conjunction of "equals" restrictions for each entry in the map.

Same as manually creating a conjunction via conjunction() and adding an equals restriction via eq(String, Object) for each map entry.

Parameters:
values - Map containing property name to value mappings
Returns:
Conjunction of "equal" constraints

jpqlRestriction

public static Criterion jpqlRestriction(String jpql,
                                        Object... value)

This method allows to create a restriction from a custom JPQL query fragment.

You may use the following set of variables in the query. They will be replaced by the correct values when the query is generated.

  • {alias}: The alias of the criteria's entity that the restriction is added to.
  • {1}, {2}, {3}...: The positional parameters that are generated for the supplied parameter values.

Example:

 Restrictions.jpqlRestriction( 
   "{alias}.firstname LIKE {1} AND {alias}.age BETWEEN {2} AND {3}", "Chr%", 40, 80)

Parameters:
jpql - The JPQL query fragment
value - The parameters to add to the generated query
Returns:
new Criterion instance

memberOf

public static Criterion memberOf(String relativePath,
                                 Object value)
Creates a "member of" restriction.

Parameters:
relativePath - relative path of a collection
value - The value to check membership for
Returns:
